Quite excited for the pilot skills. Science skills too ?

Also time between updates seems to shrink massively when you don't play the game every day

I'm really glad you guys decided to throw out the part-performance based Kerbal skills for something more substantial and less D&D. I'm sure building up a proper range of crew skills instead of quick & easy part buffs was difficult, but it's clearly getting a better response than the outcry you had over the last model.

Still holding my breath that none of the other other role skillsets have "boost %part% %stat% by x%" but assuming every skill is pilot-based and not rocket-based I'll be really happy/impressed.
if the pilot skillset allows me to keep the pin on the marble more accurately during those last few seconds of burns it'll take a lot of annoyance out of the minor efforts of the game.

Having a new gameversion ready at christmas sales would be the ultimate opportunity for a good business, and so I think the gonna see miracles happend during the next two weeks.

Also I vote for the "Beta than ever", sounds somehow better than "Beta 4 ever"

I disagree. I like the trial and error of KSP, EVEN with FAR and 3.2x scale RSS (and also, even when I played 6.4x scale RSS). Knowing everything about your delta-v removes the rocketry is a gut feel part of KSP. At a certain point you can sort of get a good feeling of the LFO and Engines needed to reach orbit and go to places. I've often noticed that players who use Kerbal Engineer lose this ability when they go back to Stock, they always overbuild or underbuild quite a bit more. And really, does knowing your Delta-V really help that much for anything but a direct replica of something? You're probably going to use your previous stage for a landing [if you overbuilt your rocket but not the lander] anyway.

Obviously you could turn them off. Nobody wants clutter they don`t need.

Felipe, the heartiest of congratulations, and my hope that the craziness of this mad dash to finishing .90 does not, and you do not let it, interfere with the happiest of nuptials.

Regarding information, I play with my eyes closed. Anything else interferes with my gut instinct for rocketry. I demand that all true kerbals do likewise, everybody else is a cheating cheater who doesn't understand the true meaning of kerbal.

"It's one small step for a man, one giant leap for two lifetimes". Congrats, Felipe!

Loving the Kerbal scout badges - can we get those sewn on their uniforms?

It opens up the way partless mods can be added - e.g. a thrust balancer mod becomes a high-level Kerbal skill. Flying VTOLs and asymmetric craft is no mean feat, so developing your first pilot capable of flying them is a real achievement...and a tragedy if you kill them!

Engineer skills could be things like fuel balancing, and certain experiments would require higher level Scientists. As a fan of the Final Frontier mod (a they get badges for skills, so should they get ribbons for landmark achievements), I'm looking forward to this!

Best of luck with the XenForo implementation. Would be good to see it used here.

Pilot skills sound great as well
